H0.text: According to L Frank Baum's 'The Wonderful Wizard of Oz', the Road to the City of Emeralds is paved with what. Gold

H1.text: According to L Frank Baum's 'The Wonderful Wizard of Oz', the Road to the City of Emeralds is paved with what. Silver

H2.text: According to L Frank Baum's 'The Wonderful Wizard of Oz', the Road to the City of Emeralds is paved with what. Ruby

H3.text: According to L Frank Baum's 'The Wonderful Wizard of Oz', the Road to the City of Emeralds is paved with what. Yellowbrick

A4.text: the road is first introduced in the third chapter of The Wonderful Wizard of Oz. It begins in the heart of the eastern quadrant called Munchkin Country in the Land of Oz. and leads to the imperial capital of Oz, the Emerald City, which is located in the exact center of the land.

A5.text: the road is mostly referred to as the 'Road of Yellow Bricks' in the original story
